div.div: Suppose there are now 3 choices in the proposal chain:
1. proposal n + 1, created at height t, perfectly legal;
2. proposal (n + 1)'', also created at height t, not legal;
3. proposal (n + 1)'', created at height t + 1, perfectly legal;
The answer for a Keeper who wants to create a new proposal is then simple:
1. since proposal (n + 1)'' is not legal, it can be challenged for a reward;
2. because (n + 1)'' was created at height t + 1, a proposal based on it will not pass until t + 1 + x. 3. because (n + 1)'' was created at height t + 1, a proposal based on it will not pass;
3. because (n + 1)'' was created at height t, proposals based on it have to wait until t + x to pass;
So eventually, the Keeper must initiate a new proposal after proposal n + 1.
